name: Lost for Words! 5 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Which word is missing for this well-known lyric?

"Everybody's doing a brand-new dance, now
Come on baby, do the ______
I know you'll get to like it if you give it a chance now"
questions.explanation:
loco-motion.

	"The Loco-Motion" has been a hit for Little Eva, real name Eva Boyd, in 1962 Grand Funk Railroad in 1974 and Kylie Minogue in 1988.

questions.text:
"He rocks in the treetops all day long
Hoppin' and a-boppin' and a-singin' his song
All the little birds on J-Bird Street
Love to hear the ______ go tweet, tweet, tweet."

Which little bird's doing all the tweeting?
questions.explanation:
robin.

	"Rockin' Robin" was a 1972 Motown hit for Michael Jackson.It was originally recorded by its writer Bobby Day.

questions.text:
A girl's name is missing from this well-known lyric.

"Good golly ____________, sure like a ball
Good golly, ____________, sure like a ball
When you're rockin' and a rollin' can't hear your momma call."
questions.explanation:
Miss Molly.

	"Good Golly Miss Molly" was a hit for Little Richard in 1958. Little Richard, real name Richard Penniman, was famed for his brutal treatment of the piano key and unrestrained vocal style.

questions.text:
"When I'm watchin' my TV and a man comes on and tell me 
How white my shirts can be 
But, he can't be a man 'cause he doesn't smoke 
The same ______ as me."

So what is he smoking?
questions.explanation:
cigarettes.

	"(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction" was a Mick Jagger and Keith Richards composition for The Rolling Stones. This track topped the US and UK charts in 1965.

questions.text:
"A long long time ago 
I can still remember how 
That music used to make me ______
And I knew if I had my chance 
That I could make those people dance."

What did the music make singer Don McLean do?
questions.explanation:
smile.

	These lyrics come from "American Pie". Don McLean both wrote and sung this 1972 classic. The single charted at #1 in the US and #2 in the UK.

questions.text:
"For tonight is the night, for feeling alright 
We'll be making ______ the whole night through 
So I'm saving all my love 
Yes I'm saving all my love."

So what is Whitney Houston up-to all night in this song?
questions.explanation:
love.

	Whitney Houston sang these words on the song "Saving All My Love for You". A hit in 1985, this chart topping single was written by Gerry Goffin and Michael Masser.

questions.text:
Which word is missing from this lyric?

"Relax don't do it 
When you want to go to it 
Relax don't do it 
When you want to _____"
questions.explanation:
come.

	Lyrics from Frankie Goes To Hollywood's controversial tune 1983 "Relax". This UK outfit, fronted by Holly Johnson, took "Relax" to #1 in the UK, and #10 in the charts.

questions.text:
"Friday night arrives without a suitcase
______ morning creeping like a nun
Monday's child has learned to tie his bootlace
See how they run."

Which day is missing from this Beatles lyric?
questions.explanation:
Sunday.

	These words are from the Beatles classic "Lady Madonna". A 1968 UK chart topper, written by John Lennon and McCartney, "Lady Madonna" peaked at #4 in the US charts.

questions.text:
"When somebody loves you 
It's no good unless he loves you, all the ______
Happy to be near you 
When you need someone to cheer you, all the ______."

A song from the legendary Frank Sinatra, but which one?
questions.explanation:
way.

	Frank Sinatra sang these words in the song "All The Way", a hit in 1957.

questions.text:
"My my my ______
Why why why ______
I could see, that girl was no good for me
But I was lost like a slave that no man could free."

It should be easy enough to fill the gap in this final lyric.
questions.explanation:
Delilah.

	"Delilah" was a hit for	Tom Jones in 1968. This dramatic song from the Welsh wonder peaked at #2 in the UK charts. Still going strong after 40 years of music making, Tom's best selling album "Reload" was released in 1999.
